title: Darius: Blood of Noxus Lore Analysis

embed.description: In all Runeterra, there is no army more feared than that of the Noxian empire. In all Noxus, there is no soldier more respected than Darius. Of all the commandments that have kept Noxus strong, one rule stands above all others: Loyalty is everything.

body:
**Timeline of the Comic**

* **22 Years Ago:** Basilich submits to Noxus. Darius, Draven, and Quill are seemingly teenagers.
* **19 Years Ago:** Darius and Quill make out at Blackrock Mere before they march off to "opposite sides of the empire".
* **10 Years Ago**: The last time Darius came to Basilich.
* **9 Years Ago:** Darius and Quill observe the handiwork of a Zaunite alchemist (gee, I wonder who that could be). Darius reports to Captain Cyrus that the road to Navori is clear, which is a region in Ionia, meaning the invasion of Ionia took place 9 years ago. Later during the retreat, Quill's arm is amputated to prevent the alchemist's poison from killing her.
* **5 Years Ago:** The last time Darius saw Quill in person.
* **5 Years Agoâ€”Present:** Darius' call to arms drafts Quill's son into army, who is killed in the Freljord.
* **Present Day:** Basilich rebels under Quill, forcing Darius and Draven to retake the city. Quill is killed by Invetia, and the city is reclaimed.
___
Darius and Draven hail from Basilich, a city first shown in the Medarda Heirloom that came out with the Piltover/Zaun event. If you look closely at the map, Basilich is under the stewardship of ~~Quilletta Varn~~ Invetia Varn; they were actually teased before the comic. Quill and Invetia share the same surname, and because Darius says, "I thought _your son_ occupied the role," it's possible that Invetia is Quill's daughter. When Invetia kills Quill, she reminds Darius that she learned the three principles of strength from him, which lends more credence to the idea that she is Quill and Darius' daughter. While talking with Quill, Darius and Draven spot ships from the city of Vindor to the south, sent by Steward Amenesce. Vindor and Amenesce were also shown on the map prior to the comic, and sure enough, they're southeast of Basilich.
https://68.media.tumblr.com/ae3a682439ce06ccc2bdb99ede129561/tumblr_ouwf4jEqaG1salezdo1_1280.png
Tamara, the warmason accompanying Darius and Draven to Basilich, first appeared as the POV character of the _Progress Day_ short story (which also came out during the Piltover event), which Draven eludes to with the line "All that time in Piltover has made you soft." I cannot find any other mention of Emystan, who employed the Zaunite alchemist.

In the manga/anime One Piece, there is one thing you can always be assured of: if a character doesn't die in front of your eyes, you can safely assume that that character is alive, despite the other characters saying that they are dead.

However, that is One Piece, and the writer, Oda, doesn't like death in his story. Just this comic alone shows us that Riot writers are not like that. However, we are only _told_ that the kid dies. We are not 100% certain if he his.

While we have strong reason to believe that he his dead, it is very possible that the writers are intentionally trying to make us think that, that way, if they ever bring him back in some form, the surprise factor is that more impactful.

One thing I found interesting was how good a relationship Darius has with Draven. It's a nice contrast to Garen, who would be considered the better moral figure, and certainly far less brutal and compromising when compared to Darius, but he also has an *awful* relationship with Lux.

It's almost like Demacia and Noxus highlight the lesser-seen sides of Jedi and Sith.

Jedi (Demacians) are noble, just defenders...who are distrustful of anything outside of their own code and who want personal ties to take a backseat to duty and honor.

Sith (Noxians) are brutal, conquering warlords...who are actually allowed to have *feelings* so long as those feelings aren't a weakness or a liability.
